32046.name: {7Around the {8R{7idge{x
description: {7The path narrows even more, as one slope drops away, and the other
steepens.  Loose rock tumbles about as you walk.  A swift breeze
threatens to carry you down the bank, to certain death.

32027.name: {#P{3ath {7between the {#F{3i{&el{3d{#s{x
description: As you walk along the path, not much is visible.  Long stalks of wheat
sprout up in the fields to either side of you.  No side trails appear,
and the road seems well travelled.

32098.name: The FAR side of the lake

32003.name: {7Fork in the {#P{3ath{x
description: The single path from before splits off into two seperate paths.
The path to the north continues through the field, yet the path
to the east enters an area where the shrubs start to dominate.
The birdsong is coming from the east, and a small trail of
whispy {8smoke{x is coming from the north.

32058.name: {7North of the {^Creek{x
description: {7In the middle of the valley, you are surrounded by trees, and
bushes.  The {^creek{7 that gives life to the greenery of the valley, is
on your south side.  The path through the trees seem worn in from use.
There are strange markings on one of the trees.  It is the sign of a
Ranger.  A sweet breeze stirs the leaves on the ground, and causes the
tall grass to sway.  {x

32056.name: {7Western end of the Valley
description: {7On the West, the large mountain hinders all path, it also creates
the Western peak of the Valley.  As you descend deeper into the
Valley, more vegitation sprouts up.  Trees and shrubs are more common,
There is also an increase in humidity, Unlike the barren mountains, a
sweet smell of life whispers through the air.  A slight trickle
of water can be heard from the East.  {x

32025.name: {&Before A {8C{7a{8v{7e{x
description: {7The trees spread open like a gaping mouth as the path widens before
a cave.  The entrance is large and it is too dark to tell if anything
dwells inside.  You notice no tracks in the area, a strange smell
does seem to be swifting around on the currents of air.  Making it hard
to discern exactly where it is coming from.

32024.name: {7Deep In The {@F{2o{@r{2e{@s{2t{x
description: Again the forest is too cluttered for anymore easterly travel.  The
trees are just as tall here as in the rest of the forest.  To the side
there is a stagnant pool of water.  It is big enough to swim in,
although the water doesn't look very inviting.

32020.name: {7In The {@F{2o{@r{2e{@s{2t{x
description: The trees here have grown in a similar fashion to the rest, except
for one incredibly large tree that surpasses all the others.
The tree grows up normally, but then bends to shoot between many
other trees in this part of the forest.  The bark on the top side
of the bend seems to be slightly worn.
A phrase has been carved into the trunk if the tree, it reads:
{3"For a great view simply, 'climb the tree'"{x

32009.name: Front of a Hill
description: The small hill here has been cleared of almost all trees.  The path
you have been following all day ends, as soon as it touches the grass.
The small little footprints are all over the place here.  The grass
that grows on the hill isn't too tall, as if it was maintained.
There are no other exits, except the one of which you entered this
part of the land.

32038.name: {7Turn in the {3Path{x
description: No harvest will come from this area of land.  The ground is too
dry, and the soil very poor.  Instead, small {2shrubs{x, and stalks of
{@grass{x have shot up all over the place.  The rocky path seems to wind
northward into the closest mountains in the area, and runs south into
the field.

32018.name: {7Depth's of the {@F{2o{@r{2e{@s{2t{x
description: The sun is shining brightly through the tips of the trees.  The scent
of pine, sticks in the air, as it does on the trees.  Small birds
and squirrels are darting here and there, chatting in their own
dialect.  A patch of beautiful flowers grow in a semi-circle around
a stunted tree.

32015.name: {7Entrance to the {@F{2o{@r{2e{@s{2t{x
description: For some reason the trail ends.  Small unused paths continue to the
south, and east.  The trees block out everything else, small plants
clutter the ground in front of you, and the rest of the forest bed.

32017.name: {7In The {@F{2o{@r{2e{@s{2t{x
description: The forest thickens, and vines begin to protrude from the trees.
Large amounts of fungi have begun growing in this region.  Small
rocks and stones jut up all over the place.  Moss droops off
branches like, drool from a dog, gently swaying with the calm
breeze.

32064.name: UnderWater Cavern
description: {8This is a small alcoved room.  The ceiling lies seven feet above the
uneven floor.  Jags, and crags stick out from everywhere.  Small
flickerings of {#light {8protrude from the pool floor.  The stone
walls look solid, and don't seem to have ever been worked.  The
naturally formed room doesn't lead anywhere else.{x

32016.name: {7Corner of the {@F{2o{@r{2e{@s{2t{x
description: Gigantic trees tower over all the lesser plant life.  Shrubs and
ferns pop up all over the place.  Grass grows in a scattered, and
uncontrolled fashion.  A small game trail crisscrosses, and cuts
toward the east.

32049.name: {7Fork in the {8Mountains{x
description: {7The well worn trail that runs North to South looks nothing like
its smaller counterpart that runs off to the West.  To the East the
path dips between to large boulders, making it a fairly tight fit.
The Northern mountain wall is fast aproaching, it is now clearly visible.
One small jagged rock sticks out in the middle of the path.  A hazard
to the weary or hasty traveler.

32045.name: {8Mountain {7Path{x
description: {7The worn path runs East to West between two large ridges.  The path
is fairly narrow, and movement is somewhat hindered by the rocky
terrain.  Small {3marmots{7 dash in and out of little wholes on the sides
of the ridges.  {x

32032.name: {7SomeWhere in a {#F{3i{&e{3l{#d{x
description: Nothing changes, the path weaves in and around nothing.  The wheat makes
a feeble yet unchallenged barrier.  Nothing else is predeterminable.

32066.name: {3Deep {@R{2a{@v{2i{@n{2e{x
description: {7The crest of the first hill in the mountains leads into a deep ravine.
It is not very hazardous, as the terrain isn't too steep.  The vegitation
is minimum, and it is mostly made up of loos dirt, and granite {8rocks{7,
apparently the ravine leads nowhere.  The {^stream{7 which would have
created such a wonderfull spectacle has long since dried up.{x

32035.name: {7Walking in a {#F{3i{&e{3l{#d{x
description: At last the small path seems to stabalize.  It heads in one steady
direction.  Still nothing has changed, except now you can see small
wisps of smoke coming from further down the path.

32053.name: {7Down to the Valley
description: {7The cliff wall comes back down to the path, and then hits a
switchback.  The terrain is easy to travel, and is mostly just gravel.
Ocasional tuffs of grass have sprouted up through the areas of loose
rock, althought these small patches do not appear to be in the best of
condition.  They are plauged with discoloration, from lack of water.
The trail then leads to slope down to the South.  {x

32007.name: {7Along the Trodden {#P{3ath{x
description: At yet another bend in the trail, you come across a deep set
small sized human footprint.  It is easily destigishable, and
is leading towards the eastern part of the forest.  The warm
morning {#l{3i{7g{3h{#t{x, glistens off of the {^dew {xcovered
{@g{2r{@a{2s{@s{x.  The birds sing cheerfull melodies, and
flutter about carelessly.

32043.name: {8J{7agged {8Rocks{x
description: Two Jagged rocks tower above you.  They have been leaned up against
each other to form a large upside-down V.  This landmark is the begining
of the path through the mountains.  Lose rock topples beneath your feet
as you clamber up under the V, before you stands a gray void, the air
is dry and arid, vegitation has abruptly come to an end.  Rocks, and
hills are all that is visible to the North.

32042.name: {3Bridge {7at the {bC{Br{^e{6e{7k{x
description: On this side of the hill, a small creek trickles through a natural
ditch running to the East.  A small wooden bridge has been constructed
to ensure safe passage.  The bridge appears to be in good condition,
and is wide enough for a trade caravan.  To the North the begining
of a rocky path can be seen.

32061.name: {7East of the {^Creek{x
description: {7On the East side, where the mountain rises up to hinder your path,
it is very damp.  Because of the large trees, and other foilage, the
rock is very damp, and in most places is covered in moss.  The shallow
{^creek{7 that comes in from the North, swings West, while continuing its
path South.  The {^creek{7 appears to contain very clean water.  A
refreshing site for the weary traveller.  Remains of past camps can be
seen on the valley floor.  Old fire pits, and cleared areas for
bedrolls mark this as a popular spot.  {x

32031.name: {8Rocks {7in the {#F{3i{&e{3l{#d{x
description: For some unknown reason, whoever farms these fields has neglected
to remove many large rocks which lay all about this portion of the field.
They don't really get in the way.  But where the rocks are, there
isn't any wheat.  The path continues onward in an abstract fashion,
everthing other than your close reality, is blocked out by the field.

32004.name: {7A Trodden {#P{3ath{x
description: The wheat from the field has died down, and large green shrubs
have shot up all over the place.  The chirping of the birds is
getting louder as you walk on.  The path is slightly muddy
from rain.  The beggining of small hills are visible to the
north east.
{x
{yYou find yourself within a{w strange place. {yCavernous stone walls span
{yto dizzying heights all ab{wout you as only {ya faint ray of light falls
{yfrom high above through an{w opening you can{ynot reach by will or magic.
{yIn the dim light, you can {8make out a stran{yge pile of stone, and upon
{yit there is a tablet with {8writing upon its{y flat face. There seems to
{ybe no other features to th{8e makeshift alta{yr, the tablet or this room
{yto suggest who or what mad{8e it and what it{ys purpose might be, though
{ya thick layer of dust cove{8ring everything {ysuggests that this strange
{yroom has been empty for ag{8es. In the dim l{yight the tablet is legible.{x

32029.name: {7Stumbling Through the {#F{3i{&e{3l{#d{x
description: Like walking through a hedge maze, it is hard to understand what you
are doing.  The small path you are following doesn't go in just one
direction.  It goes here, then there, then back here again.  Not
alowing any chance to gain a good bearing.  It is hard to see where
you are going.  Wheat still completely encompasses everything around
you.  It as if you were in a vast see or white, and gold.

32060.name: {7Corner of the Valley
description: {7Here in the corner of the Valley, it is very seculive.  A large
grove of trees have rooted themselves tightly in the small area.
Shortly to the SouthWest, there is a small creek.  It is that very
creek which gives life to the whole valley.  It is possible to
navigate through the trees either to the South, or to the West.  {x

32000.name: Tomb of Asundral
description: {&As you enter into the giant chamber the cave opens up into a
large vault.  The smell is that of old parchments and small
dead rodents.  {7Pale {&stagalmites give off the only light.  You
cannot see the roof for the light doesn't extend far enough.
About thirty-five feet inwards, you notice a large {8stone{& box
inlined with thousands of runes created with a time long before
yours.  All around the tomb there are golden trinkets and valued
items of whoever rests inside the crypt.  As you near the tomb
itself you notice that there is one message that everyone can
read.  It is illuminated in a {3g{8l{3o{8o{3m{8y {&irridesence, and says this 'Here
Lay Asundral, Pillager of all!'{x

32036.name: {7Clearing in a {#F{3i{&e{3l{#d{x
description: {7This large circular area of the field has been cleared.  A makeshift
camp has been set up.  There is one poorly structured hide tent, and
plenty of bedrolls strewn about a large firepit.  A couple buckets of
water have even been brought in from a nearby stream.  The only way
out of the camp, is back to the north where you came from.
{x

32037.name: {7End of the {#F{3ield{x
description: As the worn path continues, the {#golden {xfield does not.  The further
north you walk the less and less remains.  The soil appears to be dry
and poorly irrigated.  There is no aparent attempt as to anyone farming
this part of the land.  The path continues north, to south.

32044.name: {7Fork in the {8Mountains{x
description: {7An unclimbable crest is directly North-West of here.  A path has
been worn into the mountain side leading East to West, and another
winding off to the North.  Small {3marmots {7skitter around, running from
hole to hole.  {x

32005.name: {7Turn in the Trodden {#P{3ath{x
description: As you continue down the path, it turns north abrubtly.  The
thickening shrubs, small plants, and now even small trees
clutter the ground like a thin forest.  The trail has many
footprints in it now, some animal, others not.  The birds which
are now visible seem to be enjoying every moment of their life.

32014.name: {7Turn in the {#P{3ath{x
description: Large fur trees line the valley.  Taller than the eye can see spread
out amongst you like giant pillars.  Their sweet smell wafting up
your nose.  The sun's rays are breaking through in certain places
casting shadows to and fro.  The path twists to the east, deeper
still into the forest.

32040.name: {3Shack {7along the {3Path{x
description: At the side of the path there is an abandoned shack.  The shack is
run down and broken.  The roof is missing shingles and sags in various
places.  The siding of the house has rotted away, beams hang down
from the ceiling, the inside has been overun by vegitation.  It all
stands undisturbed.  The path still goes North to South.

32059.name: South of the {^Creek{x
description: {7Here on the South side of the {^creek{7, There isn't enough room to
make camp.  The trees have grown too close together, and most of the
ground is muddy from a past washout of the {^creek{7.  Nonetheless their
is a squirrel that is singing to its hearts content, obviously
enjoying himself while he forages for his nest.  {x

32022.name: {7Walking through a {@F{2o{@r{2e{@s{2t{x
description: All about you the trees tower like giants.  Just staring down from
their anceint branches.  These trees have seen many men come and go.
many more will pass them by.  If they could they would laugh, not
because of their vast lifespan, but having the knowledge that they
are captive.  Stuck for all eternity.

32006.name: {7Along the Trodden {#P{3ath{x
description: As you walk down the path that is begining to narrow, the fresh
smell of pine is being wafted all around.  The {@t{2r{1e{2e{@s{x are closer
together, and the ground is covered with {@p{2l{@a{2n{@t{@l{2i{@f{2e{x.  Small
human footprints can be made out quite clearly on this part
of the path.

32023.name: {7The End Of The {3P{#at{3h{x
description: The Interwinding trees become so thick that it is no longer possible
to continue on to the east.  The small slightly worn in path now
goes onto the south.  There is a large bird nest in one of the trees,
the nest is about the size of a dwarf'd kenku.

32047.name: {7Switchback Through the {8Mountains{x
description: {7A Sharp bend on the mountain trail suddenly turns steep.  Loose rocks
and previous slide marks from other travelers are visibly apparent.
A swift {Bbreeze{7 whistles its way, causing cloaks to flap, and
making the climb even more tedious.
{x

32001.name: Begining of the field
description: As you enter onto the plains you see many things, first
of all there is the {#golden wheat {xblowing in the wind.
The trodden path that you follow is worn in and because
of lack ot rain the path is very dry.  Small {2shrubbery{x
grows all around you.  In the distance to the east you can
see the mountains.  To the west looms CandleKeep, the north
beholds the Friendly Arm Inn, and to the south lies Bergost.

32011.name: Small Bedroom
description: The small room is outlined by lantern light shows for small concaving
walls.  A small bed is on the farthest side from the door.  There
is a night-table beside the bed, and a wodden dresser beside the
door.

32052.name: {7Along the {8Wall{x
description: {7The path slopes up to its uneven peak, and then slopes back down.
Upon looking down from the ledge, it is discernable that to fall would
certainly be death.  Jagged rocks pount out at frequent intervals.
The height of the fall itself would be difficult for a simple mortal
to survive.  The uneven mountain floor below would not lend any
comfort to the whole ordeal.  {x

32063.name: {7Top of a {@T{2r{@e{2e{x
description: The bark on the top of this giant tree is quite worn.  It is easy to
walk upon, and shows an incredible view of the area.  You can see
the vast forest in all directions, a small cave to the south.  The
many fields of wheat to the far east, and the begining of a rocky
path to the north.

32010.name: Entrance to a house
description: This small house is filled with the stench of stale air.  It is
quite chill, and very little natural light, lights up the room.
a small semi-circle shaped window.  {@G{2r{@e{2e{@n{2 g{@r{2a{@s{2s{x and {^s{7k{^y{x is all that
you can see out of it.  The room is layed out in three main portions
the first is where you stand, there is a floor mat and a wall hook
and a wooden closet.  Deeper in the room there is a small fireplace,
by the {!f{1i{#r{3e{7p{3l{#a{1c{!e{x sits an old worn-in {!c{1h{8a{1i{!r{x.  A picture of an old
halfling is the only decoration that adorns the walls.  There seem
to be more rooms to the east, and south.

32050.name: {7Cliff {8Wall{x
description: {7The path turns against the large mountainside.  The rockface is
vertical, small ledges and handholds jut out in awkward places making
the climb possible, but unlikely.  The actuall path itself is no longer
loose gravel but medium sized boulders that have been flattened, and
ground into the dirt.{x

32008.name: {7Fork in the {*Road{x
description: This a large three-way fork in the road, the dirt path leads north,
south, and east.  The small footprints unmistakabley go east.
To the north the forest is thickening.  Here the light shines
through the skinny trees, the early morning fog is thinning, and
the whole area has the effect of just being on fire.

32039.name: {7Along the {3Path{x
description: Another twist in the path show nothing new, the scenary is the same
as it was before.  Low rolling hills, accompannied by a dusty trail to
the north that leads into the begining of the mountains.  South of course
would take a man to the {#wheat{x fields.

32055.name: {7Into the {8M{7ountains{x
description: {7This is the crest of the hill, from here you can go in every direction.
The hill is bare and offers no trouble concerning navigation.  To the
{!N{1orth{7 a {@ravine{7 is the only thing that is visible.{x
{3An old sign reads {&"{#Be wary of Gnolls, these mountains are infested!{&"{x

32030.name: {7Sharp Bend in the {#F{3i{&e{3l{#d{x
description: After following the path, it switches back due south.  The wheat stalks
still prohibit any new observations about your surrounding area.

32034.name: {7Corner in a {#F{3i{&e{3l{#d{x
description: Another switchback, again the path twists to the southwest.  Still
nothing new can be seen.  A light smell of smoke travels with the wind.

32062.name: Small Kitchen
description: This small room is used to make a poor excuse for a kitchen.  On
the backside of the fireplace, a hot-plate, and kettle rack have
been set up.  There is a wooden table beside a large waterbarrel.
A few pots and pans are hung on the wall, wooden cupboards are
hung on the opposite wall of the pots.  This room is illuminated
by a single flickering lantern.

32028.name: {7Following the {#P{3ath{x
description: As you continue down there is still no change.  The tall fields
flow back and forth with the wind.  You cannot tell what is past or
beside you.  Abruptly as you are passing by, a small path is visible
to the west.  It is not a real path, more of an intrusion in the field.
The path is not cut, it appears as if someone just walked right
through it.

32019.name: {7Corner of a {@F{2o{@r{2e{@s{2t{x
description: The small trail that deftly twists between trees doesn't seem to go
very far.  The south, and west is completely blocked off by dense
walls of thorns, and thistles.  The wall is so thick any sort of
further travel would be impossible.

32026.name: {&Inside The {8C{7a{8v{7e{x
description: {8The cave is about 20 feet high.  It doesn't go in very deep.  But
it is fairly wide. Darkness surrounds everything, because no outside
light seeps in.  The air is musty and smells of wet dog.  The cavern
floor is flat, and has been cleared of all rough, or jagged rocks.
{x

32065.name: {7Inside the {3Hide Tent{x
description: {7The inside of the tent is quite messy.  Bedrolls, and packs are
strewn about the room.  dirty clothing has been tossed about, and the
stench of decay sit contently in the confinement of the small space.
The door to the tent is on the east wall.

32048.name: {7Tight Squeeze{x
description: {7The trail abruptly goes between to very close pieces of rock.  The
rock peices are each larger than two giants.  The space in between
is so small that even a gnome would have a difficult time fitting his
way past the barricade.  The rock formations are almost sheer making
it so only an expert mountaineer could scale them.{x

32021.name: {7Depth's of the {@F{2o{@r{2e{@s{2t{x
description: Trees and plants grow alike, in the ussual fashion.  Trails lead off
in every which direction.  There is a small patch where the shrubbery
has been supressed.  The patch is muddy, with tracks all around it.
On close expection speckles of blood can be spotted.

32057.name: {7Entrance to the Valley{x
description: {7 To the West lies the junction of the mountain entrance.  To the
North there is a large rock, easily mistaken for a mountain.  The
temperature is cool, and the sun hits the foilage creating lots of
shade.  A small {^stream{7 trickles, and runs off to the east.  The ground
is well worn, made up mostly of dirt, with rocks, and boulders jutting
out irregularily.  {x

32041.name: {7Turn on a {2H{@ill{x
description: As you crest the hill, both sides of the path are now visible.  To
the south the vast fields of {3wheat{x sway with the wind, an old
shack is visible as well.  To the North some jagged landmass's have
seemingly risen from the ground.  The {8stone{x mounds making travel
a little more difficult.

32002.name: Continuing down a field
description: As you continue through the {#golden {xfield, you notice a wide
variety of birds happily chirpping as they go about their daily
business.  The path is begining to widen yet it still leads
onwards toward the north.

32013.name: {7A Trodden {#P{3ath{x
description: Further along the path, the trees begin to grow closer and
closer together.  The worn dirt path continues straight to the
north, and heads deeper into the forest.  To the northwest, the
vast rockface is still visible.

32000.name: A {1Ko{!bo{1ld{x~
description:
Barely clearing three feet in height, the {1ko{!bo{1ld{x has a
rust brown scaly hide.  He smells of damp dog and stagnant
water.  His eyes {!glow{x like a bright red spark and it
has two tan horns protruding from its head.  He wears 
tattered clothing and has a rat-like tail.

32001.name: The Tomb Guardian~
description:
{7The Guardian of the Tomb is a large Death Knight.  
He is wearing {8jet black{7 field plate, that no light
will reflect off of.  From the inside of his mask the only
two things visable are the {1red embers{7 of his eternal 
eyes.  He stands over six feet tall, and has an average yet
undeterminable build.  He carrys a large morning-star.{x
32001.d_flags: D A Guardian of the Tomb falls to the ground dead!~
subroutines:
F for AHMV
F par GHIJK
32001.room_name: The Guardian of the tomb is standing here.

32002.name: A small Halfling ~
description:
He stands a little over three feet tall, and has strewn about
{3sandy {xcolored hair.  He wears a small {@f{2o{1re{2s{@t {xcolored tunic,
under his leather armor.  The color in his {^eyes{x, are reflected
by the {^b{6a{^n{6d{^a{6n{^a{x which he wears.
32002.room_name: A small Halfling, is walking around

32003.name: pool mob~
subroutines: M SPEECH 32002 go for a swim~

32004.name: KuaToa~
description:
{&This large fishlike creature, might actual resemble and overweight
human from a distance.  Upon a closer inspection you notice that his
head is that of a fish's, his hands and feet are webbed claws.  slimy
scales line his entire body, and he has a small tail hanging off
its back.  Strapped to its back it has a seaweed-mesh harness for his
deadly harpoon.

32005.name: A Bear~
description:
{3This lagre mammal is covered with thick fur.  It walks around on 
all fours.  Each paw ends with large viscous claws.  Its oversized 
head carries with it a very powerfull bite.  
{x

32007.name: {7Fat {1Ko{!bo{1ld{x~
description:
{7This {1Ko{!bo{1ld {7looks like all the rest of his kind, except 
that he is slightly taller, and a lot fatter.  He also wears quite
an impressice suite of leather armor.{x
32007.room_name: {7Standing here looking stupid, is a fat {1Ko{!bo{1ld{x

32008.name: A flind~
description:
The flind is similar to a gnoll in body style, though it is a
little shorter, and broader.  They are more muscular than their
cousins.  Short, dirty, brown and red fur covers thier body.  Their
foreheads do not slope back as far, and their ears are rounded, but
still animal like.
32008.room_name: A Stout Flind is resting on the ground.

32009.name: a gibberling~
description:
This awkward creature is actually a hunchbacked humanoid, with
pointed canine ears, a black mane that surrounds it hideous face.  Its
eyes are black, and shine with a maniacal gleam.  They carry short
swords in their overly long arms.
32009.room_name: A Gibberling is chittering away to itself.

32010.name: a worg~
description:
The Worg is a variation of a wolf.  It is a little bit larger than
its cousin and has a more coarse coat of dark grey hair.
32010.room_name: A large Worg stalks around the room.

32055.name: A Gnoll~
description:
While the body of a gnoll is shaped like that of a large human, he
details are those of a hyena.  They stand erect on two legs and have
hands that can manipulate as well as those of any human.  They have
greenish gray skin, darker near the muzzle, with a short reddish gray
to a dull yellow mane.
32055.room_name: A Tall Gnoll stands around snarling.
